intro: Trianthema sheilae, commonly known as the Sheilae sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Trianthema sheilae is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
